Header: Customs officials foil an attempt to smuggle out foreign currency
Content: Customs officials have succeeded in foiling an attempt to smuggle out of the country a large haul of foreign currency. The foreign currency was recovered from the possession of an Indian national who arrived at the Airport to leave for Singapore. Customs Media Spokesman Sunil Jayaratne announced that the value of the foreign currency was more than 20 million rupees. The Customs Media Spokesman said that an Indian national has been detained at the Bandaranaike International Airport for attempting to smuggle out a stock of foreign currency. The suspect, who had arrived in the country from Tamil Nadu, was preparing to leave for Singapore this morning at 1.00 a.m. when the Customs officers attached to the BIA apprehended him. The Customs Officers accordingly have seized foreign currency including 19,250 sterling pounds, 95,000 Euros, 71,500 Saudi Riyal and 21,000 Arab Emirates Dirham estimated to be worth over 27 million rupees.
